forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain and patchy fog. Cloudy, with a low around 38. North wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain and patchy fog before 7am, then patchy fog and a slight chance of rain between 7am and noon. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 44. Northwest wind 5 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
In the quiet hours of the night, Boston finds itself draped under a soft blanket of clouds, laced with the possibility of rain and whispers of fog. The temperature slides mercifully, urging one to snuggle deeper under the covers. A gentle north wind stirs, a fleeting caress, making the cool air feel even more crisp. As dawn approaches, expect a lingering shroud of fog and a slight chance of rain — a reminder that nature dances in its own time. The day will shape up to be mostly cloudy with a cool high, inviting those who venture out to wrap themselves in layers—perhaps a warm sweater under a light jacket, with a sturdy pair of shoes fit for the occasion.

As you navigate through your Sunday, the hushed tones of fog hovering over the streets could be an inviting backdrop for a leisurely stroll through the quieter neighborhoods of the city. The crispness in the air may set the stage for a warm cup of coffee at a local café, where the world feels unhurried and reflective. This mist-laden day might just be the perfect invitation to explore quiet corners of the city, perhaps perusing the shelves of a favorite bookstore or indulging in the solitude of a park, where every droplet of moisture glistens in the muted light. Embrace the serenity of a foggy afternoon, where time feels suspended and the simple pleasures of life come to the forefront.
